item.title: Linda add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!" -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Linda add a quote by Annie Proulx (Brokeback Mountain)
item.description: "If you can't fix it, you have to stand it." -- Annie Proulx (Brokeback Mountain)

item.title: Linda add a quote by Linda Collison
item.description: "Like billiard balls colliding our courses were altered." -- Linda Collison

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Linda add a quote by Martin Niemöller
Linda add a quote by dave eggers
item.description: "We are unusual and tragic and alive." -- dave eggers

item.title: Linda add a quote by Nicolette Milnes Walker
item.description: "Still, I could find no good reason for not going. So I decided to go." -- Nicolette Milnes Walker

item.title: Linda add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "Wit is the unexpected copulation of ideas." -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Linda add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description:
"Two weevils crept from the crumbs. 'You see those weevils, Stephen?' said Jack solemnly.
I do.'
Which would you choose?'
There is not a scrap of difference. Arcades ambo. They are the same species of curculio, and there is nothing to choose between them.'
But suppose you had to choose?'
Then I should choose the right-hand weevil; it has a perceptible advantage in both length and breadth.'
There I have you,' cried Jack. 'You are bit - you are completely dished. Don't you know that in the Navy you must always choose the lesser of two weevils? Oh ha, ha, ha, ha!" -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Linda add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Linda add a quote by Wallace Stegner
item.description: "It should not be denied... that being footloose has always exhilarated us. It is associated in our minds with escape from history and oppression and law and irksome obligations, with absolute freedom, and the road has always led West." -- Wallace Stegner

item.title: Linda add a quote by Wallace Stegner
item.description: "Something will have gone out of us as a people if we ever let the remaining wilderness be destroyed ... We simply need that wild country available to us, even if we never do more than drive to its edge and look in." -- Wallace Stegner

item.title: Linda add a quote by Wallace Stegner
item.description: "He used to tell me, 'Do what you like to do. It'll probably turn out to be what you do best." -- Wallace Stegner

item.title: Linda add a quote by Wallace Stegner
item.description: "We write to make sense of it all." -- Wallace Stegner

item.title: Linda add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What's your name,' Coraline asked the cat. 'Look, I'm Coraline. Okay?' 'Cats don't have names,' it said. 'No?' said Coraline. 'No,' said the cat. 'Now you people have names. That's because you don't know who you are. We know who we are, so we don't need names." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Linda add a quote by Linda Collison
item.description: "Fuck Kerouac; he would write his own story." -- Linda Collison
